formatedText.text: Ты прошёл страну и теперь в твоём скринсейвере доступен новый фон!

text.string: Чтобы разбить фишку, наведи на неё молоток
Кликни на какой-нибудь фишке, чтобы разбить
все фишки одного с ней цвета
Чтобы разбить область фишек, наведи на них бомбу
Кликни по какой-нибудь фишке, чтобы разбить все фишки, лежащие с ней
на одной горизонтали, вертикали и диагонали
Как раз в этот день, когда было заключено
это немыслимое пари, Филеас Фогг рассчитал
провинился в том, что принёс своему
хозяину воду для бритья, нагретую до 84
и теперь наш джентельмен дома ожидал
нового слугу, который должен был вот вот
Покидая Лондон, Филеас Фогг, без сомнения не подозревал
что его отъезд вызовет такой большой шум. Известие о пари
по милости репортёров, это возбуждение перекинулось
в газеты, а через газеты оно передалось населению
повышенным интересом общественности к путешествию Фогга,
председатель Реформ-клуба мистер Смит решает заручиться
поддержкой своего старого знакомого - полицейского агента
Тем временем наш почтенный джентельмен и его слуга
благополучно добрались до столицы Франции - Парижа.
Едва сойдя с поезда, путешественники спешат в порт,
в Египет. Ничто не должно помешать планам сэра
Ну где же он? Теперь, в моём положении,
я не могу себе позволить терять ни минуты.
Наконец-то! Вы француз и Вас зовут Джон?
Жан, с вашего позволения, Жан Паспарту.
и у меня о вас хорошие сведения.
Вы мне подходите. Известны ли вам мои условия?
Да сударь. Я готов приступить прямо сейчас!
Да - я должен сдержать своё слово
Поэтому мы не можем терять ни минуты.
Но мистер Фогг... А как же багаж?
Я тем временем улажу свои дела в Лондоне.
всё должно быть готово к нашему отъезду.
Хорошо, мистер Фогг, я всё сделаю. Но...
И Паспарту - ни в коем случае не забудьте
мой дневник. Без него наше путешествие
Вот так дела! А я то думал,
что устраиваюсь на работу к самому
Ох, чувствую я, что ничего хорошего
Но как бы то ни было, надо собирать
саквояж. Ну и где же этот дневник?..
Ничего, сударь. Я собрал всё необходимое
Осталась ещё одна, самая важная вещь.
Мистер Фогг, я не мог ничего забыть!
Если вы имеете в виду ваш дневник,
Нет, Паспарту, это касается моего пари.
Для того, чтобы мне его выиграть,
Из каждой страны на нашем маршруте
марки из любой страны можно найти
в Лондонской почте - и никуда ехать
не опустится до жульничества! К тому же
это уникальные марки - найти их можно
Ладно, за дело, Паспарту - нам надо
заполучить марку, прежде чем мы сможем
Да, мистер Фикс, мне необходима ваша
помощь в одной деликатном деле. Вы уже
наверняка слышали об этом Филеасе Фогге,
сможет объехать весь мир за 80 дней?
Это меня и беспокоит, мистер Фикс.
Дело в том, что такой интерес к
Я безусловно уверен, что Фогг ни за что
не успеет в срок завершить своё
путешествие. Но тем не менее, мистер Фикс,
я прошу вас проследить за Фоггом и
информировать меня о каждом его шаге.
Хорошо, мистер Смит. Больше от меня
Конечно, ни в коем случае не вызывая
Я понял, сэр. Можете не беспокоиться
на этот счёт - я сделаю всё, что
Разумеется, я не останусь перед вами
в долгу, мистер Фикс, слово джентельмена!
О, Париж - я не был в Париже 5 лет! А ведь я
здесь вырос, мистер Фогг. Хотите, я покажу вам
свои родные места? Заглянем к моей тётушке и...
Паспарту, самое дорогое в нашем с вами
путешествии - время! Мы не может тратить его
понапрасну. К тому же, мы уже почти пришли в порт.
Джентельмены, чем я могу вам помочь?
Мы хотели бы отправиться на вашем
Корабль после шторма был сильно повреждён
и нуждается в ремонте. Отплыть можно только
Но я не могу так долго ждать!
Ремонт корабля, милорд, это непростая задача.
К тому же многие детали не пережили шторма и
требуют замены. Да и к чему такая спешка, милорд?
Вы же в Париже - отдохните, осмотритесь.
Да, мистер Фогг, отличный повод зайти к моей...
Паспарту! Давайте лучше подумаем, как нам помочь
и у меня о Вас хорошие сведения, поэтому
я принимаю Вас на работу, Паспарту
Я буду рад работать у столь почтенного господина.
Поэтому нам нельзя терять ни минуты.
Только ручной саквояж с самым необходимым.

formatedText.text: Страница 1. Первый абзац
Страница 1. Второй абзац.

Именно сегодня у меня появился новый слуга, француз по имени Паспарту. Он был ошеломлен новостью о кругосветном путешествии, но безропотно начал собираться. Таким и должен быть слуга - кажется, на этот раз мне повезло. Впрочем, вещей беру с собой немного - необходимое купим в дороге. Настоящий джентльмен путешествует по миру с одним саквояжем.
Третья страница. Запись номер один.
Третья страница, Запись номер два.
Третья страница, Запись номер три.

text.string: Do you really want to exit?

text.text: The game will be closed. Do you want to continue?
There is a reward for completing the whole journey -- an animated 3D screensaver that will be yours to keep. It will decorate your screen and remind you of your glorious achievements.
Your mission is accomplished and you can now receive your reward - Atlantis 3D Screensaver!
Click to download and install a premium- quality animated 3D screensaver that will remind you of your glorious achievements.
Click to install a premium-quality animated 3D screensaver that will remind you of your glorious achievements.

formatedText.text: Это марка, которую вы собрали в Англии.
Это марка, которую вы собрали во Франции.
Это марка, которую вы собрали в Египте.
Это марка, которую вы собрали в Индии.
Это марка, которую вы собрали в Китае.
Это марка, которую вы собрали в Японии.
Это марка, которую вы собрали в Америке.
А это слот под марку.

text.string: Do you really want to exit now?
Your game will be saved. However, if you
exit now you will lose your last life.
You can then resume your journey starting
from the first level in this land.
Try again and may you have
the best of luck in your
Try again and may you have the best of

TextResources.string: and now select the new place for it
Select chip to destroy all chips with the same color

text.text: The hearts on the panel to the left are extra lives you have remaining.
After every completed level you get to learn some valuable information on the land you are in.
The more tiles you match in one go, the more energy is added to the Sun power-up.
The Sun power-up is re-set after every level whereas all the other bonuses remain with you until you use them. It is a good idea to utilize the Sun power-up as soon as it is charged.
Use the bonuses only when you have to. They will come in handy later in your travels as the levels get more and more difficult.
Try to score more points. Every 100 000 bring you an extra life.
Get bonus points for completing a level quickly.
Try to collect all the bonuses available on the levels you go through. Things may become difficult without them as you proceed in your journey.
You will be rewarded with a premium Atlantis 3D screensaver at the end of the journey.
You get bonus points for longer chains. These are marked with "Terrific!", "Fantastic!" and "SPECTACULAR!"
It is a good idea to utilize the Sun power-up on the more difficult levels by intentionally working to recharge it as quickly as possible.
You can replay the levels you already completed to pick up the uncollected bonuses you may need.
The Lightning bonus does not only help you get rid of inconvenient tiles but also decreases the number of types of tiles in the game field that may be very useful sometimes.
Try to get rid of the locked tiles at the very beginning as it may be much more difficult to do once they drop lower on the field.
Use the Swap bonus wisely. It can move the artifact pieces away from the wall.
All scores are saved in the High Scores table. It is displayed automatically if no keys are pressed in the main menu window for a few moments.
When thinking of what bonus to use keep in mind that the Time and the Swap bonuses will come in very handy on the more difficult levels.
It is usually easier to get rid of frozen tiles at the very beginning.
The game does not end even after you complete all the levels. There are new bonuses to collect and adventures to embark on so you are welcome to continue playing.
You can always check what bonuses have been left uncollected on the levels you already completed and go back to get them.
Try to free the artifact pieces one by one to avoid having several of them at the bottom of the game field at once. That usually makes matching difficult.
You can always go back to view the animated clips from your journey by pressing the "Travels" button in the main menu.
Every artifact gives you control over a certain power that is related to the country you got it from. You will need all seven to raise the Atlantis.
You can always view the artifacts you have collected with related info by selecting the Altar of Poseidon symbol in the top left-hand corner of the map.
The Altar of Poseidon in the main menu shows how many artifacts you have collected thus far.
Keep up the good work and discover the mystery of Atlantis at the end of your travels.
The hearts on the panel to the left are extra lives you have remaining.

formatedText.text: This is the day I hired a new servant, a Frenchman by the name Passepartout. The news of the journey around the world came as a shock to him, yet he started packing without a word. This is the manner a servant should be. It appears that this time I may have found the right man. We are not taking much luggage. A proper gentleman travels around the world with a light carpet-bag.

The most important thing that Passepartout packed is my personal note-book. These notes will become documented evidence of my journey. Perhaps one day, many years from now, I will read them to my children.

I had an argument with Mr. Stuart, chairman of the Reform Club, about whether it is possible to travel around the world in 80 days. He got so agitated trying to prove me wrong that bet his post of the chairman! Quite honestly he is not the only one who thinks it is impossible to do. Well, gentleman, you will soon see who is right...

This wager has already been referred to as fantastic and inconceivable. I wonder what they will say when I win. My opinion is that there is nothing fantastic about it. All there is here is superb calculation and passion that characterize a true Englishman.

Do I feel strongly about the success of this enterprise? By all means! A true Englishman will not start a new venture unless he is at least 50 per cent sure of the favourable outcome. We are departing for Paris today!

Here we are in Paris. We were finally able to get to the port, yet there was no ship we could embark upon to continue to Egypt. We are thus faced with the first impediments in our journey. The steamer Magnolia we were to board here has gotten into a serious storm. The damage it suffered hinders it from being able to depart within the next two weeks! I have made a decision to help with the repair of the ship whatever the costs.

The additional expenditures to replace the damaged parts promise to be quite substantial, yet the game is worth the candle. Passepartout will help me. I do not like to compliment the servants but it appears that this one is indeed a stroke of luck. However, time will tell...

According to Passepartout, Paris is the most beautiful city. The Eiffel Tower, the Champs-Elysees, not to mention Passepartout's auntie's house -- all these are of course of great interest. However we cannot devote any time to sight-seeing. Our goal is to get the ship repaired as soon as possible and we have absolutely no time to spare!
I am positive I will win the bet. The calculation is accurate, I simply could not err. Yet I feel somewhat anxious. My reputation and wellbeing are at stake.

All done! The vessel has been repaired and is ready to set sail. We start for Egypt in an hour. We must hurry to get a stamp! Before the Magnolia departs I must find myself proof of my stay in this country...

I could not expect such a turn of events! Having just gone off board in Egypt I was immediately detained by the authorities on suspicion of a robbery of the Egyptian Museum. This is indeed ridiculous! Still, I had to comply and await the arrival of further details of the crime. I have a feeling as if all of this was staged to cause a delay in my journey. But who could do that..?

I have been taken to jail and it looks like they are planning to keep me in custody. They say that because of the incident at the museum the port has been closed altogether, therefore the Magnolia will not leave until the relics have been found. My journey is on the brink of failure!

I am struck by the local traditions that are utterly different from the European. No one speaks English here and I am completely unaware of the events outside. What's the current state of the investigation? Am I still the prime suspect? I can only guess and wait.

Time goes by painfully slowly. My solitude is only consoled by this note-book that they allowed me to take into the cell. The carpet-bag remains with Passepartout. He is my only hope now. No one else can get me out of here. I wonder how he is doing?

I finally got a chance to see and talk to Passepartout! He was able to bribe the guard to allow us a short meeting. We did not have much time and Passepartout could not tell me all. He swore he would get me out of here. He said he is very close to solving this robbery and he only lacks some evidence.

Passepartout saved the day! He is quite some quick fellow I must note. He got me out of jail, helped solve the crime and collect the relics. Now the port is open and the Magnolia can depart for India. It is time to hurry. The journey continues!

Destiny has presented me with an unexpected gift. We ran into a charming yet very sad young lady at the railway station. Her name is Aouda and she told us her story. It turns out that her uncle wants to marry her to a rich and old rajah against her will. She is terrified but no one asks about the bride's consent in India. I must help her!

Everybody knows that India is a great reversed triangle of land, with its base in the north and its apex in the south. The British Crown exercises a real and despotic dominion over the larger portion of this vast country. Yet there are certain ferocious rajahs in the interior who are absolutely independent and uphold the old and often very cruel traditions.

My attention is constantly drawn to Aouda. She is Indian but has the manners of a true English aristocrat, speaks the language with great purity and is absolutely charming. It was worth getting into the risky wager just for the chance to meet her here.

The greed and thirst for gold of Aouda's uncle is quite astonishing. He is prepared to abandon his intention to marry his niece but needs 'weighty arguments' as he put it. Aouda confirmed my suspicions on what that meant -- a generous offering. That is disgusting!

I will note that the Indian Ocean has been favourable, the wind being in the north-west, and all sails aiding the engine. The trip was accomplished most successfully and ahead of time resulting in a gain. I am sure this will be very useful!

Thus, we have been able to convince the uncle to cancel Aouda's wedding. It was not easy. Jewelry and expensive gifts turned out more convincing than any words. We are happy to have Aouda with us in this wonderful journey.

A new blow came in China. All of the country is celebrating the Festival of the Fiery Dragon and it is absolutely impossible to get through the crowd. Until the festival is over we will not be able to leave the country… The idea came quite unexpectedly -- we will travel to Japan on a hot air balloon! However this may not be as easy to accomplish as it seemed at first.

We found a merchant with a stock of balloons but were not able to purchase anything. The old man is not interested in money but is willing to give us a balloon if we crack his riddles. It sounds incredible but nonetheless it is indeed so. We will have to solve his riddles or our brilliant plan on leaving this country is not to be realized.

The journey from India to China is one I shall remember for a long time. I will take note of one thing here: the construction of the railway line that was announced to be completed was in fact not, therefore we had to secure a means of conveyance which came at a rather serious price. Aouda endured the cumbersome journey very well!

In the meantime the big Festival of the Fiery Dragon here continues and there is no end in sight. Passepartout and Aouda are enraptured by the scale and brilliance of the celebration. The air is filled with kites and fireworks. Thousands of people are in the streets with colorful lanterns. Alas, I do not have time for this. I have to solve these mysterious riddles.

The Celestial Empire is extraordinary! I did not pay a pound for the balloon but I did have to spend some time puzzling over the old man's riddles. I just have to put one down for the record. What light on a pitch-dark night gives? What luck on a long journey brings and from misfortunes protects?

Thus, we reached the shores of Japan on a hot air balloon and made it safely to Yokohama where new impediments have been in store for us. This time around Passepartout went into a sacred temple with his shoes on. It is unbelievable but the punishment for a crime like that is two months of imprisonment. We shall undertake to make a generous offering to the temple to try to free him.

It is a matter of honour for me to free Passeparout, for I cannot leave him here entirely alone. I shall never forget how he liberated me from detention in Egypt when I was falsely accused of the museum robbery.
We are presently in Yokohama. Having reached Japan by air we made the journey to this major seaport by land. This is where we will depart for America from.
Yokohama is a principal Japanese port on the Pacific Ocean which takes both cargo and passenger vessels. It is very busy around the clock.

Japan strikes me with the constant whirl of people in the streets. Among the coaches, palanquins and rickshas women mince along in kimonos, the latter being a type of national Japanese costume somewhat similar to a housecoat girded with a wide silk scarf.

I remember my servant Passepartout first looking with great curiosity at everything in the Land of the Rising Sun. It looked as if he was finally beginning to like this journey. Alas, his curiosity cost him dearly. I should not have left him alone...

Our offering for the temple priests is almost ready. I hope it will help to mitigate the punishment and perhaps even free Passepartout. Getting all the gifts was not an easy task -- the culture of this country remains a mystery to me. I thanked Aouda for her help. Her knowledge of the Japanese traditions was instrumental in the choice of gifts to offer.

At last Passepartout is free! It is essential to know the customs and traditions of a country one is traveling to. It is an unwritten law that Passepartout unintentionally broke. The result of that was a delay in time and additional several hundred pounds that it cost us.

We were late to get on the Concord, for Liverpool, by just three-quarters of an hour! There is only one ship in harbor that would be able to transport us to Europe but the captain thereof turned out to be a very strange gentleman indeed. It seems impossible to convince him to take us aboard his ship.

The captain is a very interesting character whose passion is indeed quite astonishing. He is obsessed with pirates! It's unbelievable but just like the old man in China, the captain is not interested in money at all. It looks like we will have to find a way to win his trust somehow.

My fellow-travellers are in a state of despair. We crossed America from the Pacific to the Atlantic to only lose the boat by three-quarters of an hour. It is overwhelming at this point, when we are so close to the final destination!

A separate book of its own could be written about the adventures we encountered on the way. As a matter of fact I expected certain possible obstacles because the "great trunk line" which crosses the entire width of the United States goes through a territory which is still infested by Indians and wild beasts, and a large tract which the Mormons, after they were driven from Illinois in 1845, began to colonise.

The expectations were, alas, legitimate. First a great herd of buffaloes formed an insurmountable obstacle to the passage of the train, then a suspension-bridge thrown over some rapids turned out to be in a ruinous condition. I am again amazed at Aouda's courage!

Scarcely had the train passed the river, when the bridge, completely ruined, fell with a crash into the rapids… Then the train was attacked by a band of Sioux. Aouda behaved courageously from the first. She defended herself like a true heroine with a revolver, which she shot through the broken windows. The remainder of the journey to Omaha we were forced to undertake on a sledge...

Thus, I have been able to win the captain's favor by means of exploitation of his wild passion for everything pirate. He is prepared to help us reach Europe. We are ready to set sail for Britain now and there is still hope that the wager can be won if we can get to Liverpool on time!
